intro: Coreopsis mutica var. holotricha, commonly known as the hairy coreopsis, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. The plant produces bright yellow to orange flowers that bloom in the summer months. It is a perennial species that thrives in full sun and well-drained soil. Its compact growth habit makes it a popular choice for garden borders and wildflower gardens.
